summary: a 36-year-old woman was admitted to the intensive care unit for septic shock. lab work showed a leukocytosis of 13.4 109/L, hemoglobin of 7.4 g/dL, and thrombocytopenia of 53 109/L. her triglycerides were elevated to 367 mg/dL. her triglycerides were elevated to 367 mg/dL. dexamethasone was restarted and resulted in remarkable improvement. possible triggers for her HLH were investigated. hepatosplenomegaly and a higher level of serum ferritin were more commonly seen in HLH-associated Kikuchi-Fujimoto disease. HLH that is left untreated has a high mortality rate.
